channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbreakingNews
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbreakingNews, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Huge raid on Rio gang leaves at least 10 people dead and 80 under arrest

Hurricane Melissa slams Jamaica: How to help
item.description: As Jamaica works to recover after hurricane Melissa, here are ways to help the island nation.

item.title: Chicago’s children are getting caught in the chaos of immigration crackdowns
WATCH: Japanese PM gifts Trump late Shinzo Abe's putter
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi gifted President Trump the putter of late Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe during his visit to Tokyo.

item.title: Senate fails to advance GOP bill to end shutdown for 13th time
item.description: The Senate failed for a 13th time on advancing a GOP funding bill that would end the government shutdown, now on Day 28. Follow live updates here.

item.title: WATCH: Hurricane Melissa has made landfall in Jamaica as a Category 5 hurricane
item.description: Melissa is set to bring catastrophic winds, rain, flooding and storm surge to Jamaica, where residents and tourists are sheltering in place.

item.title: Gold's price plunges below $4,000. Here's how investors can take advantage.
item.description: Gold's price continued to decline this week. Here's how investors can take advantage of this timely opportunity.

item.title: Melissa is one of the strongest hurricanes recorded in the Atlantic
item.description: Hurricane Melissa​, which struck Jamaica as a Category 5, is among the strongest hurricanes to have formed in the Atlantic since records were kept.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa live updates: Category 5 hurricane makes landfall in Jamaica
item.description: Hurricane Melissa, now a powerful Category 5 storm, is set to be Jamaica's worst storm in history.

item.title: Obesity rate is declining as more Americans use weight loss drugs, survey finds
item.description: As more Americans turn to weight loss drugs, the U.S. adult obesity rate​ is declining, according to new survey data from Gallup​.
